definition: to run away/to escape
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
to escape/to run away/to flee
see 臨陣退縮|临阵退缩[lin2 zhen4 tui4 suo1]

sentences.english: The soldiers were punished for their base conduct in running away from the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 那些士兵由於臨陣脫逃的可恥行爲受到懲罰。

sentences.english: Freddy chickened out of the plan at the last minute.
sentences.chinese: 弗雷迪臨陣脫逃，最終退出了這個計劃。

sentences.english: He let the opportunity slip and fled the field.
sentences.chinese: 他錯過了機會，而且臨陣脫逃。

sentences.english: He was accused of running away when the enemy attacked.
sentences.chinese: 他被指控在敵人進攻時臨陣脫逃。

sentences.english: Another was escaping from a locked tank that was filled with water.
sentences.chinese: 另一項則是從裝滿水的上鎖水缸中脫逃。

sentences.english: Only a coward perched to escape.
Put him in a designed crisis to see if he will escape or change his mind.
sentences.chinese: 設計一個危機的狀況，看他會不會臨陣脫逃。

sentences.english: Henry wanted to ask Sue on a date, but then he chickened out.
sentences.chinese: 亨利想約蘇出去，但是他後來卻臨陣脫逃。

sentences.english: Several white-livered fellows ran away at the beginning of the battle.
sentences.chinese: 戰鬥一開始，幾個膽小鬼就臨陣脫逃。

sentences.english: The horse broke free from its stable.
sentences.chinese: 那匹馬從馬廄裏脫逃而出。

sentences.english: He knew that once he had caught the sly fox he need not worry about him escaping.
sentences.chinese: 他知道已經收服了的老狐狸不怕他再脫逃。

sentences.english: Other immobilizing effects might let you make escape attempts.
sentences.chinese: 其他定身效應也可能讓你可以嘗試脫逃。

sentences.english: He goes on to explain that after Bauer was apprehended he escaped.
sentences.chinese: 他繼續彙報說，鮑爾在被逮捕後，設法脫逃了。

sentences.english: What do you wish?Tobe known as a shirk.
sentences.chinese: 你希望成爲怎樣的人？是被認爲臨陣脫逃者。

sentences.english: Twice when Purvis had Dillinger surrounded he escaped.
sentences.chinese: 普維斯曾兩次將迪林格包圍，但他都成功脫逃。

definition: to besiege
not to shrink from any crime (idiom); to commit any imaginable misdeed
lit. not an inch of steel (idiom); unarmed and defenseless
to loot/looting
to visit a prisoner (usu. a relative or friend)
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
to set a trap
night attack
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
to conceal one's identity/living incognito
to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
to conspire with sb/to plot/a conspirator/a partner in crime/an accomplice
to loot/to pillage/to sack
to imprison
fire of war everywhere (idiom); enveloped in the flames of war
